definitions.definition: in or to a lower position than somebody/something; under somebody/something

examples.text: They found the body buried beneath a pile of leaves.
The boat sank beneath the waves.
He considers such jobs beneath him.
They thought she had married beneath her *(= married a man of lower social status)*.

wordOrigin: Old English binithan, bineothan, from bi (be, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bij and German bei) + nithan, neothan ‘below’, of Germanic origin; related to nether.
